headline.main: Vitamin Supplements Are Seen As No Guard Against Diseases

docs.lead_paragraph: A large and careful study to see if vitamins can protect against cancer and heart disease has found no evidence of any such benefit and even hints at actual harm. The finding is surprising because many earlier studies had suggested a benefit from these supplements, vitamin E and beta-carotene. Experts involved in the study say it is possible a benefit may emerge as the study continues. They also say that the advice to eat a lot of fresh fruit and vegetables still stands, since the benefit seen in earlier studies may have come from something other than the vitamins. But the experts acknowledge that the case for vitamin supplements should be considered unproved for now.
